alert.note: Alert for Lower Garfield and Asotin Counties; Washington Palouse (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 3:23PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Latah, northwestern Nez Perce, southeastern Whitman and northeastern Asotin Counties through 400 PM PDT... At 322 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Clarkston, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lewiston, Clarkston, Genesee, and West Clarkston-Highland. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 95 in Idaho between mile markers 304 and 330. U.S. Highway 12 in Idaho between mile markers 0 and 11. U.S. Highway 12 in Washington between mile markers 433 and 434. U.S. Highway 195 in Washington between mile markers 0 and 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Lower Garfield and Asotin Counties; Washington Palouse
